meanings.definition: Make an attack or assault in return for a similar attack.
meanings.sent1: When someone hits you, you may retaliate by hitting back.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers decided to retaliate after the enemy's ambush.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to retaliate playfully by pouncing on its toy.
meanings.sent4: The waves seemed to retaliate against the shore, crashing with force.
meanings.sent5: In the game, players can retaliate against opponents to defend themselves.

meanings.definition: Respond to an action with a corresponding action.
meanings.sent1: If you smile at her, she will retaliate with a smile too.
meanings.sent2: The team captain always retaliates quickly to any challenges faced.
meanings.sent3: The robot seemed to retaliate by beeping in response to the command.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seemed to retaliate by blooming beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The students will retaliate with enthusiasm to the teacher's encouragement.

meanings.sent1: He wanted to retaliate against those who had wronged him.
meanings.sent2: The character in the story planned to retaliate for the betrayal.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to retaliate by stealing the bird's food.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to retaliate by pouring rain on the city.
meanings.sent5: The hero in the movie will retaliate against the villain for justice.
